contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Francine Jordi | image = Francine Jordi Wien 13-9-2008b.jpg | caption = Francine Jordi (Vienna 2008) | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Francine Lehmann | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1977|6|24}} | death_date = | origin = [[Worb]], [[Canton of Bern]], [[Switzerland]] | genre = [[Schlager]], [[Volksmusik]] | occupation = [[Singing|Singer]] | years_active = 1998–present | label = | website = [http://www.francinejordi.ch/ www.francinejordi.ch] }} '''Francine Jordi''' (born '''Francine Lehmann''', 24 June 1977, in [[Worb]], [[Canton of Bern]]) is a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] [[Pop music|pop]] singer. As a young child she was already singing songs for the [[Japan]]ese tourists in [[Interlaken]]. With this musical background she won the [[Germany|German]] [[Grand Prix der Volksmusik]] in 1998 with the song ''Das Feuer der Sehnsucht''. From that moment on Jordi became a real star in Switzerland with golden discs, successes in the charts and tours throughout the [[German language|German speaking]] countries. She also hosted two TV shows at the [[ARD (TV)|ARD]]. In 2002 she represented Switzerland at the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] in [[Tallinn]] with a [[French language]] song "[[Dans le jardin de mon âme]]".<ref>{{cite book|last=Bohlman|first=Philip V.|title=The music of European nationalism|year=2004|publisher=ABC-CLIO|location=Santa Barbara, Calif.|isbn=978-1-57607-270-7|url=http://books.google.com/?id=fkQf7k2OaDcC&pg=PA2&dq=the+eurovision+song+contest+2002#v=onepage&q=the%20eurovision%20song%20contest%202002&f=false|accessdate=6 February 2011|page=2}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Eurovision Song Contest 2002|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/history/by-year/contest?event=316|publisher=European Broadcasting Union|accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> In the autumn of that year she made a solo tour with her band throughout Switzerland. ==Discography== * (1998) ''Das Feuer der Sehnsucht'' * (1999) ''Ein Märchen aus Eis'' * (2000) ''Wunschlos glücklich'' * (2001) ''Verliebt in das Leben'' * (2002) ''Im Garten meiner Seele'' * (2003) ''Alles steht und fällt mit Dir'' * (2004) ''Einfach Francine Jordi'' - compilation * (2005) ''Halt mich'' * (2007) ''Dann kamst du'' * (2009) ''Meine kleine grosse Welt'' * (2011) ''Lago Maggiore'' (with Florian Ast) - single * (2013) ''Verliebt geliebt'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Francine Jordi}} * [http://www.francinejordi.ch/ Official Site] {{de icon}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[Jane Bogaert]]<br>with ''"[[La vita cos'è?]]"'' | title=[[Switzerland in the Eurovision Song Contest]] | years=[[Eurovision Song Contest 2002|2002]] | after=[[Piero and the MusicStars]]<br>with ''"[[Celebrate (Piero Esteriore & The MusicStars song)|Celebrate]]"'' }} {{s-end}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2011}} {{Authority control|VIAF=79982053}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Jordi, Francine | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss singer | DATE OF BIRTH =24 June 1977 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jordi, Francine}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Worb]] [[Category:Swiss female singers]] [[Category:Swiss Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 2002]] {{Switzerland-singer-stub}}
